Authors: Tung-Chin Huang, Ting-Hsuan Hung, Yuan-Min Shen
Title:
Roestelia niitakayamensis, a new rust species on Photinia
niitakayamensis in Taiwan
Keywords:
Rust fungus, Pucciniaceae, Gymnosporangium, Ribosomal RNA
gene, Taxonomy
Abstract:
Background The rust genus Roestelia is a
spermogonial-aecial anamorph of Gymnosporangium species. An undescribed
species of Roestelia was found on leaves of Photinia niitakayamensis
near Mt. Hehuan in central Taiwan. Results Roestelia niitakayamensis sp.
nov. is characterized by the presence of smooth outer wall, rugose side
wall, and coralloid projection inner wall on the peridial cells, and the
echinulate processes on aeciospores. Sequences of the SSU rDNA,
ITS1-5.8S rDNA-ITS2, and the LSU rDNA of R. niitakayamensis and G.
asiaticum were obtained, with 96% identity between the two species.
Phylogenetic relationships inferred by partial LSU sequences indicated
that R. niitakayamensis is close to G. confusum, G. asiaticum, and G.
unicorne. Conclusion The unique morphological and molecular
characteristics showed that R. niitakayamensis, an endemic rust fungus
in Taiwan, is new to science.
